alert.note: Alert for Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 21 at 4:23PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR AN ICE JAM REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM AKDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam continues. * WHERE...Yukon River near From the Nowitna River downstream to Nulato. * WHEN...Until 300 PM AKDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying areas. Water over roads in low lying areas. Fish camps and cabins in low lying areas could see minor flooding. Ice could push onshore over low spots in the river bank. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 411 PM AKDT, The public reported that the ice jam on Yukon River near the Nowitna River released early Sunday morning, and is moving downstream. High water and a heavy run of ice is now moving past Galena, and will get to Koyukuk late this afternoon or evening, and to Nulato this evening or late tonight. Minor flooding is expected in most low lying areas between the Nowitna and Nulato. The large amount of water backed up behind this jam will take many days to drain so water levels on the Yukon will remain high for a number of days. - The river is starting to crest in Galena. Flooding of low lying areas and roads is occuring in Galena and some ice has pushed onshore. Flooding in Galena is expected to be minor, and no homes in Galena are expected to flood. Low lying areas all along the Yukon River between the Nowitna River and Nulato can expect minor flooding, including low lying sections of Koyukuk and Nulato. Fish camps and cabins in low lying areas could see minor flooding. Flooding is not expected in Ruby due to its higher elevation above the river. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Nulato, Koyukuk and Galena. - For Yukon River at Galena: At 10:00am Sunday the stage was 122.0 feet. Flood Stage is 124.0 feet. - For Yukon River at Ruby: At 11:00am Sunday the stage was 35.4 feet. Flood Stage is 40.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood - If you live near or along the Yukon between the Nowitna River and Nulato prepare for minor flooding. Move valuables such as vehicles and boats out of low lying areas and store them on higher ground.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.

area.areaDesc: Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys
